comments.body:
Without `float`, shap.force_plot raises the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "binary_classification.py", line 38, in <module>
    shap.force_plot(base_values, shap_values[0, :], X.iloc[0, :], matplotlib=True)
  File "/xxx/python3.6/site-packages/shap/plots/_force.py", line 80, in force
    if type(base_value) == np.ndarray and len(base_value) == 1:
TypeError: len() of unsized object
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@
# show a force plot
shap.force_plot(float(base_values), shap_values[0, :], X.iloc[0, :], matplotlib=True)
